title: 'Dhurandhar' day 38: Ranveer-led film's global collection now Rs 1254.9 crore
description: In an astounding theatrical journey, Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' has captivated audiences for over 38 days, raking in an impressive Rs 805.65 crore net domestically. On a global scale, the espionage thriller has soared to new heights, achieving an unprecedented Rs 1254.9 crore worldwide, making it the highest-grossing Hindi film to date.

title: Run machine rolls on: Kohli breaks Sachin's record; surpasses Sangakkara
description: Virat Kohli became the fastest player to reach 28,000 international runs in 624 innings during India's ODI against New Zealand. He also surpassed Kumar Sangakkara to become the second-highest run-scorer in international cricket. The Baroda Cricket Association honored Kohli and Rohit Sharma at the historic match.

title: German Chancellor arrives in India: Merz begins first official visit
description: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz is on a two-day visit to India, meeting PM Modi in Ahmedabad. Their agenda includes visiting Sabarmati Ashram and the International Kite Festival, followed by bilateral talks in Gandhinagar. Discussions will center on strengthening the India-Germany Strategic Partnership, focusing on trade, technology, and defense cooperation, building on recent high-level interactions.

Indore diarrhoea deaths: Blindspotting in India’s cleanest city
description: Contaminated drinking water, supplied through government-laid pipelines, led to a diarrhoea outbreak in Indore, killing at least 8 and affecting about 3,000 people. Mehul Malpani reports on unplanned parts of one of Madhya Pradesh’s most promising cities, the delays in laying pipelines, and the blame game that follows when deaths get international coverage

title: Travis Kelce reportedly needs Taylor Swift’s approval before another NFL season
description: Travis Kelce is weighing whether to return to the NFL after a disappointing season with the Kansas City Chiefs. Sources say he is not ready to retire but will take weeks to decide, discussing his future with family and fiancée Taylor Swift as personal priorities and roster uncertainty complicate the call.

California wealth tax: 200-plus billionaires could be affected - full list
description: California is considering a one-time 5% wealth tax on residents with over $1 billion, potentially impacting tech titans like Larry Page and Mark Zuckerberg. While some, like Nvidia's Jensen Huang, support it, others warn of capital flight. The proposed tax could retroactively apply from January 1, 2026, if approved.

title: Raheman Dakait arrested: Bhopal crime lord nabbed in Surat; multi-state syndicate busted
description: Surat police apprehended Aabid Ali Irani, the alleged kingpin of the Bhopal-based Raju Irani gang, after he evaded a major police crackdown. Wanted for numerous crimes across multiple states, Irani is accused of a shocking attempt to set a family ablaze. The gang specialized in impersonating law enforcement and employing elaborate disguises for their heists.

title: Connor McDavid’s wife Lauren Kyle confirms delay in Sports Club Atelier collection
description: Lauren Kyle, founder of Sports Club Atelier and wife of Connor McDavid, shared an update on her upcoming collaboration with Hockey Canada, confirming a slight delay in the launch. She emphasized the importance of getting every detail right. The collection follows the success of her earlier releases, which blend hockey culture with luxury streetwear.

title: Vanessa Bryant thanks fans for braving rain at emotional Mamba book signing
description: Vanessa Bryant recently hosted a 'Mamba & Mambacita Forever' book signing, drawing large crowds despite rain. The event celebrated Kobe and Gianna Bryant's enduring legacy through art and community. Fans shared personal stories, highlighting how Vanessa's foundation continues to inspire and provide sports opportunities for underserved youth, honoring her family's memory.

title: Ayesha Curry promotes Jamaican tourism after devastating hurricane
description: Ayesha Curry is urging fans to support Jamaica's recovery from Hurricane Melissa by visiting the island. She highlighted that tourism is crucial for the Jamaican economy, with nearly 30% of the workforce dependent on it. Curry emphasized that a vacation serves as a donation, with airports and most hotels now operational.
